page.title: 01Isle of Luing-North End
page.content: About 70 people live in this block, mainly in the village of Cullipool. One of the main industries is farming; the "Luing" cattle are bred here, as are many Scottish Blackface sheep. Eight men in three boats fish out of Cullipool for Lobsters, prawns and other shellfish. Tourism provides other employment. Cullipool "old" village was built in the 1860's around the now defunct slate quarries. The centre of the village has now shifted half a mile south, around the post office and small council estate. One child in the block attends the island school, & seven are pupils Oban High School. Six of these travel daily, the 7th boards weekly in the school hostel. On the east coast of the block there are the remains of an old fort, thought to be Pictish.
